comment.author: 30484128@N03
comment._content:
Quite a collection of hats.
Quite a future in store for the doomed ship.

History lives in such glimpses of times past.

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content:
The insignia on their sleeves suggests the man holding the ship's lifebouy is a Commander (a rank below the level of Captain) and the man to his left could be his second in command, the ship's Lieutenant.

Perhaps it's the Lieutenant that's depicted in Ernest Binstead's drawing?

Stuart.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47044499@N03
comment._content: So interesting - we used to look out to Tuskar Rock from Rosslare as kids on hoiliday when I was about 9 years old - that would be about 1956. Does anyone remember the St. David, St, Andrew and St. patrick mail boats that sailed from Fishguard to Rosslare?

comment.author: 24716411@N00
comment._content: Real classical ladies and gentlemen on a cruise - reminds me of the Agatha Christie story "Death on the Nile" - i am somehow looking for Hercule Poirot here... ;-)

comment.author: 93104394@N02
comment._content:
Hi, This appears to be Captain McLaughton holding the life bouy. I have several photos of him that belonged to my Great grandfather John Davies whose picture appears in the stewards department photograph.
Christine

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/rolfiecar] Thanks for this id also, Christine! You don't happen to know his first name, do you?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 93104394@N02
comment._content: I do not have a first name for the captain, writing on the back of the photo is by my grandmother and only says Captian McClaughton friend of John Davies (her father), so not sure the spelling is correct. Also the photos I have are not clear so I cant be positive it is the same person but will put the photos on Flickr .I'm new to Flickr so should I tag them SS copeland?. My research can find nothing on Captain McLaughton.

comment.author: 93104394@N02
comment._content: Having another good look at the back of the photo The Captains name is more like McLaughlin

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/rolfiecar] I've changed it to McLaughlin now, Christine! I see you got your photos uploaded - they're really gorgeous...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 93104394@N02
comment._content: Thank you I'm so happy to share these.
